Water Temp 8.10c and Conductivity 510uscm.

EventRem: Great Oxbow Series.  A huge population of P. cavaticus that covered much of the floor along a 20m section of calcite flowstone on the floor of the passage leading towards the sump that connects with the skyhook.  P. cavaticus numbered in the 100s and were feeding on a bacterial / fungal ? film present on the calcite.  Several specimens of Niphargus fontanus also observed at least one of which was observed capturing and eating a P. cavaticus  Same location as mentioned in J. Carter 95 record above.
